bridge-type.label: EspMilightHub
bridge-type.description: ADD THIS FIRST: This is for an Opensource esp8266 based Bridge/hub for Milight globes. After adding this Openhab2 can then find and use your globes after you edit and give your MQTT broker details.

parameter-group.name: Whitemode Shortcuts
parameter-group.label: Shortcuts for turning the globes back to white

parameter.name: ADDR
parameter.label: MQTT broker address
parameter.description: It is best to use localhost if the broker is located on the same computer as Openhab. Otherwise use this format tcp://192.168.1.2:1883

parameter.name: MQTT_USERNAME
parameter.label: User name for MQTT broker.
parameter.description: Enter the User name used to connect to your MQTT broker, or leave blank if none is needed to connect.

parameter.name: MQTT_PASSWORD
parameter.label: Password for MQTT Broker.
parameter.description: Enter Password for your MQTT Broker, or leave blank if none is needed to connect.

parameter.name: HUB_IP
parameter.label: HUB_IP
parameter.description: Enter the IP of the esp8266 so the binding can help setup the Hubs settings for you.

parameter.name: DEFAULT_COMMAND
parameter.label: Default command to send when nothing is selected.
parameter.description: When the send command button is pressed, if no selection is made from the list then use this command by default. TIP: use "set_white" for RGBW globes to set back to white light quickly.

parameter.name: TRIGGER_WHITE_HUE
parameter.label: The HUE value that Google home or Echo can use to turn globes back to true white.
parameter.description: When both these Hue and Saturation values are seen by the binding it will trigger the light to turn back to using the white LEDS instead of using the RGB to emulate white. Set to -1 to disable, 0 for Alexa, or 36 for Google Home.

parameter.name: TRIGGER_WHITE_SAT
parameter.label: The Saturation value that Google home or Echo can use to turn globes back to true white.
parameter.description: When both these Hue and Saturation values are seen by the binding it will trigger the light to turn back to using the white LEDS instead of using the RGB to emulate white. Set to -1 to disable, 100 for Alexa or 32 for Google Home.

parameter.name: FAVOURITE_WHITE
parameter.label: The white colour temperature that you prefer to be used as WHITE.
parameter.description: When one of the shortcuts triggers white mode, use this for the colour white instead of the default colour.

parameter.name: AUTOCTEMP_MAXDIMMED_TEMPERATURE
parameter.label: The white colour temperature that you prefer when the light is dimmed all the way down. RGB_CCT and CCT globes only.
parameter.description: Can be used to emulate the dimming of halogen globes that grow warmer the more they are dimmed. Try setting this to 350 to start with. If this is not null/empty the globes will change from the "Favourite white" colour temperature when at full brightness to this value when the globe is at the dullest brightness.

parameter.name: DELAY_BETWEEN_MQTT
parameter.label: Delay in milliseconds between all outgoing MQTT messages.
parameter.description: Use this to prevent messages building up in the esp8266 buffers if the hub can not transmit to the globes fast enough. TIP: Play with 'packet_repeats' in esp8266 control panel as lower values speed up transmit times.

parameter.name: DELAY_BETWEEN_SAME_GLOBE
parameter.label: Delay in milliseconds between multiple outgoing MQTT messages heading to the same globe in a row.
parameter.description: This feature will create less messages per second to the same globe when dragging a finger around a color item.

parameter.name: 1TRIGGERS_NIGHT_MODE
parameter.label: Make 1% brightness trigger the night mode.
parameter.description: The night mode is a much lower level of light and this allows it to be auto selected when your fader/slider moves to 1%. NOTE: Night mode locks out some of the controls from physical remotes.

parameter.name: POWERFAILS_TO_MINDIM
parameter.label: Default to the lowest level of light when the power fails.
parameter.description: If lights loose power from the power switch OR a power outage, they will default not to the previous light level but to the lowest brightness.

parameter.name: LEVEL_FOLLOWS_COLOUR
parameter.label: LEVEL_FOLLOWS_COLOUR
parameter.description: If set to false, this option remembers how bright colours are independantly to the white brightness.

parameter.name: RGBW_WHITEMODE_SAT_THRESHOLD
parameter.label: Saturation threshold for triggering white mode (RGBW globes only).
parameter.description: Since RGBW globes do not respond to saturation changes, this feature allows you to specify a number that if the saturation drops below it will trigger the white mode. -1 will disable this feature.

thing-type.label: RGB+CW+WW Globe (rgb_cct)
thing-type.description: Led globe with full Colour, cool, and warm whites with saturation controls

thing-type.label: RGB+CW+WW Globe controlled via FUT089 remote (fut089)
thing-type.description: Use this when your remote is the newer 8 group type called FUT089 and your globes are rgb_cct

thing-type.label: Dual White Globe controlled via FUT091 remote (fut091)
thing-type.description: Use this when your remote is the newer fut091 and your globes are cct

thing-type.label: Dual White Globe(cct)
thing-type.description: Led globe with both cool and warm white controls

thing-type.label: RGB and White Globe(rgbw)
thing-type.description: RGB Globe with a fixed white

channel-type.label: Level
channel-type.description: Level changes the brightness of the globe.

channel-type.label: Color temperature
channel-type.description: Change from cool to warm white with this control.

channel-type.label: Color
channel-type.description: Allows you to change the color of the globe.

channel-type.label: Nightmode
channel-type.description: Night mode: Lowest level of light that locks out changes from the remotes.

channel-type.label: Saturation
channel-type.description: Saturation is how much white light is added to a pure colour.

channel-type.label: Command to send
channel-type.description: Choose the command to send to the globe then press the button to send it multiple times. Note: Not all globes support all commands.

channel-type.label: Send selected command
channel-type.description: Send the command selected in the list.

channel-type.label: Current bulb mode
channel-type.description: Displays the mode the bulb is currently in.

channel-type.label: Disco mode
channel-type.description: Switch to a Disco mode directly by using the number. Not supported by all globe types.
